description: A dog wearing a pilot's uniform, including a hat and jacket with wings insignia, stands in the cockpit doorway of an airplane, holding a book titled 'CAPTAIN MANUAL' upside down. Human passengers seated in the cabin appear uneasy, with one man looking back at the dog with wide eyes and a furrowed brow. The scene presents the absurd and surreal situation of a dog in command of an aircraft, highlighting a profound lack of confidence in the pilot's competence through the visual gag and the passengers' reactions. The humor derives from the unexpected and unsettling juxtaposition of a domestic animal in a role of critical responsibility, underscoring a theme of misplaced trust or authority. This specific scenario involves a canine pilot in a commercial airplane cabin, observed by human passengers.
caption: “God help us all.”

other_text.location: Top center of the panel border
On the book held by the dog
